content.text: Write twenty five million in figures
Write the following in order of size, starting with the smallest
In a sale a coat costing \(250 is reduced to\) 200
Find the percentage decrease in the cost
120 students are asked to choose their favourite sport
The results are shown in the pie chart
Calculate the number of students who chose
A car took \(1 \frac{1}{2}\) hours to travel from Geneva to Gstaad
Calculate the average speed of the car
Calculate the time, in hours and minutes, that the bus took for the journey
It travelled at an average speed of \(60\mathrm{km / h}\)
Find the time it arrived in Gstaad
The distance of \(150\mathrm{km}\) is correct to the nearest \(10\mathrm{km}\)
Complete the statement for the distance, \(d \mathrm{km}\), from Geneva to Gstaad
The distance between Geneva and Gstaad is \(150\mathrm{km}\)
Calculate the mean of the seven numbers
A number from the list is chosen at random
Find the probability that the number is
Use the numbers in the list above to answer all the following questions
How much commission, in dollars, did she pay?
Tania went on holiday to Switzerland
The exchange rate was \(\$ 1 = 1.04\) Swiss francs (CHF)
She changed \(\$ 1500\) to Swiss francs and paid \(1\%\) commission
Tania spent CHF 950 on her holiday
She converted the remaining Swiss francs back into dollars
She paid CHF 10 to make the exchange
Calculate the amount, in dollars, Tania received
Find the gradient of the line \(l\)
On the grid, draw the line \(x + 2y = 6\) for \(-4 \leqslant x \leqslant 6\)
The equation of the line \(l\) is \(4x + 3y = 4\)
Use your diagram to solve the simultaneous equations \(4x + 3y = 4\) and \(x + 2y = 6\)
The bisector of angle \(ABC\) meets \(AC\) at \(T\)
Construct the perpendicular bisector of the line \(BC\)
**Parts (i), (iii), and (v) must be completed using a ruler and compasses only.**
**All construction arcs must be clearly shown.**
Using a scale of 1 centimetre to represent 5 kilometres, make a scale drawing of the path the ship
At \(Q\) the ship changes direction and sails \(30\mathrm{km}\) on a bearing of \(160^{\circ}\) to the point \(R\)
Draw the path of the ship
Find how far, in kilometres, the ship is from the starting position \(P\)
A ship sails \(40\mathrm{km}\) on a bearing of \(040^{\circ}\) from \(P\) to \(Q\)
Show that the perimeter of the field is \((6x - 10)\) metres
The perimeter of the field is 50 metres
Find the length of the field
A rectangular field has a length of \(x\) metres
The width of the field is \((2x - 5)\) metres
Describe fully the **single** transformation which maps \(A\) onto \(B\)
On the grid, draw the line \(x = 2\)
Reflection in the line \(x = 2\). Label the image \(C\)
Enlargement, scale factor 2, centre (0, 0). Label the image \(D\)
On the grid, draw the image of shape \(A\) after the following transformations
The diagram shows two shapes \(A\) and \(B\)
Find the value of \(a^{3} + 3b^{2}\) when \(a = 2\) and \(b = -2\)
Give your answer correct to 1 decimal place
Find the area of the cross-section
Calculate the volume of the ramp
Calculate the total surface area of all five faces of the ramp
Each face of the ramp is painted
Calculate the total cost of the paint
The diagram shows a ramp in the form of a triangular prism
The cross-section is a right-angled triangle of length \(5\mathrm{m}\) and height \(2\mathrm{m}\)
Complete the table showing the number of lines in each diagram
Work out the number of lines in Diagram 8
Write down an expression, in terms of \(n\), for the number of lines in Diagram \(n\)
Work out the number of lines in Diagram 100
The number of lines in Diagram \(p\) is 66
The diagrams show a sequence of shapes
